issues.description: The problem statement and UML specify a constructor SealSaloon(String) that accepts the saloon name, but the solution provides only a no-argument constructor and no name field. Students will be confused—they cannot implement the required constructor signature or store the name as described.
issues.suggested_fix: Either add a field for the saloon name and implement a public SealSaloon(String name) constructor (initializing both orders and stock), or adjust the problem statement to match a no-argument constructor approach.
